RylandsLat394.Transcription:
Brynge þe oxe to þe halleand he woll to þe
                    stalle
RylandsLat394.Note:
Written as one line; translating ‘Prospicit ad caulam bos tum
                        ducatur ad aulam’, which follows it.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 92.

BLHar541.First Lines: Brynge home no beff sir for þat ys full of bonysBut brynge home good ale I nowgh for I love wile þat…
BLHar541.Last Lines: …Bryng vs home no sydyr nor no palde wyneffor and þou do thow shalt have crystis curse and myne
BLHar541.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 92.
